review.description:
Definitely my go-to Thai spot.  

There tends to be a bit of a wait, in-house or delivery, at times. But its worth it. 

The pad see-yoo and kang noor are ridiculously good.
review.author: Nicholas A.

review.description:
We had a really good experience here.  It was cute inside.  Although a little noisy, the volume was no problem for conversation.  Food was decent, fresh Thai food--nothing crazy.  Entrees were pretty much $7-$8 so our whole meal was extremely cheap and both of us have more than half of our entrees as leftovers.  The portions are very, very large.

I am writing this review ASAP (was just there last night, and I have never been so punctual with a review!) is because as of very recently, they are no longer BYOB.  We brought a bottle of wine but then I noticed a wine list on our table and we hid the bottle as quickly as possible.  Then when another couple sat next to us, they did the same thing and were told you can no longer bring your own alcohol.  I was glad we weren't the only ones.

We went on a Monday night and we didn't have to wait, but I am pretty sure after we were seated there were zero tables left open in the restaurant.  I would imagine going on a more popular night there would be a wait.
review.author: Dana P.

review.description: Fast, friendly service and absolutely amazing Chicken Masaman Curry and Thai Basil Chicken. Very affordable too.
review.author: Samantha P.

review.description:
What up National?  My curry is full of weird tasting eggplant that's sliced too thick and carrots that are also sliced so thick they aren't cooked at ALL.  Did the veggie truck not show up today?  I'm super disappointed.  And it's not at all spicy/not very well balanced.  
Gonna probably have to pass the next time.
review.author: Chelsea M.

review.description: Good food and vibe. The staff was super friendly when we went. They closed at 10:00pm that night and we got there around 9:52pm. They still let us sit, eat and order what we wanted without rushing us or making us feel rushed. They get a plus for that!
review.author: Shanelle A.

review.description: I had the chicken fried rice with pineapple. It was amazing. Quick delivery times and moderate prices too! Definitely recommend if you're looking for some cheap but delicious take out
review.author: Mischael C.

review.description:
This restaurant really has this many stars?! 

Well perhaps it was an off night.... 

Looking at the other reviews I fear mine will seem unnecessarily scathing however my experience at this restaurant brought me out of my hiatus of doing Yelp reviews. I will keep it as short as possible:. 

-A large plain salad with not enough peanut salad dressing. Check. 
-A poorly fixed Thai iced tea. Check. 
-Bland dishes. Check and Check. 
-An inattentive server who only stopped to ask us 3 times if we were done (big ups to the guy that filled up our water though). Check again 
-Our check instead of the dessert menu. Are you kidding me? Oh Check. 

Okay maybe I should have known to ask them for well-prepared and more flavorful dishes. Maybe they don't serve dessert and my plate with over 1/3 of my food left is a sign to National staff  that my plate should be picked up. Honestly maybe its me. All I know is I have never been so rushed to finish a meal in my life nor have I ever wanted to skip out on a bill. National took me there (don't worry they were paid and we got our dessert fix elsewhere). 

Perhaps I'm too picky when it comes to Thai *kanye shrug. I don't know but I figure someone on yelp should get this perspective. I can appreciate the convenience of its location however the food we had was lackluster, the service is abysmal, and there are tens of restaurants where I'd rather spend my money in the vincinity than here. Go at your discretion and I hope you have a better experience than we did. 

Helpful tips (see trying to be positive .... :-/) Bring cash as credit cards arent accepted and ask for your dish to be made spicy.
review.author: Kyndall P.

review.description:
Well, I love Joya. So I like this place too.
BYOB Friend! Saves you $$$$!!!
Pretty good Thai as Brooklyn Thai goes. Food comes out really fast, even when they are busy. I have never waited long for food which means people don't end up waiting too long for a seat either. Curry, yum, pad thai, yum, spare ribs....ehhhh.... kinda fatty. I would most certainly recommend though.
review.author: Kristin T.

review.description:
Of all blocks I could have moved to in Fort Greene, I am so fortunate to live just a few steps from National. The number of times I have eaten here in less than a year is not only shocking, but leaves the fact that I love to cook for myself in question. (I swear, I can and I do!)

Hands down, National is the best thai food I've ever had. While everything there is great, I always seem to come back for the same thing: a calamari appetizer paired with beef pad se yu accompanied by a BYO bottle of wine is a glorious combination of happy in my tummy. Plus, their prices are staggeringly cheap for the gigantic portions they provide.

The wait for a table is a bit long (20-30 minutes) Thursday - Saturday nights, but the food is so tasty, it's worth it. But remember: to fully enjoy your experience at National, BYOB & C (cash), as they don't accept credit cards!
review.author: Sarah M.

review.description:
Delicious food and BYOB, does it get any better than that?

Personal favorite is Pad Se Yu (with beef) and the calamari (the sauce is the best part!).  

It's just about the classiest $7 meal you can get in Fort Greene.  The service is fine, just make sure you tell them you want brown rice when you order and not any time afterward!
review.author: Jenna O.

review.description:
I'll preface this by saying: 
1) Among the many, many delicious dining options available in the 'hood, Asian cuisine is still largely underrepresented.

2) I take noodles and flavor seriously.

With that said, I was more than excited to welcome Thai cuisine to the neighborhood. National is in a prime location and has a jammin' ambiance, perfect for a sultry date or summer evening dining outside.

On my most recent visit, I ordered the tom yum kung and pad thai. My tom yum was just OK. Decent and edible, by all means, but very much lacking that je nous se qoui you come to expect when you know the real deal. Nevertheless, the soup was hot and fresh, and that was that.

The pad thai arrives. Much to my dismay, the noodles are starchy and overcooked. Seriously, Thai people? You and I both know what the consistency of noodles should be and this ain't it. The flavor wasn't memorable, as good Thai food should be, but once I dressed it up w/the fresh squeezed lime and assortment of condiments, it was relatively palatable. But texture is fundamental for a noodle dish, obviously. And this hot, heaping mass was inexcusable. 

Major disappointment.
review.author: Lans S.

review.description:
It's not my favorite restaurant in Brooklyn, but it's my favorite place to get a quick bite to eat:

Let me explain: 

-Silly cheap
-Great portions
-Every dish has been tasty every time I've been there
-Get in and get out quick

Love this place.
review.author: Adam D.

review.description: Good option for delivery. Fast and fresh. The Kang Panang Gai curry (chicken) was fantastic! The Pad See Yu (chicken) was a little bland but I think it's because we are the curry first. Not amazing enough to stop me trying somewhere else but I reckon we will be ordering again someday!
review.author: Laura M.

review.description: Hate that it's cash only but it's Thai iced tea is spot on and it's red curry has just the right amount of spice.  The tofu isn't great but the veggies make up for it.
review.author: Akruti D.

review.description: Good food and the price is great. I took a friend there this week. He likes the food wanting to go back the next day. The lunch special is less than $9 and can pick any dishes on main menu.
review.author: Henry C.

review.description:
National is a step below the likes of Mango Thai and Mee* in Park Slope and Em in Carroll Gardens, but as a sit-down Thai option in a neighborhood that previously had none--and a pretty cheap one to boot--it's hard not to appreciate its presence. I feel the Pad See Ew (my go-to Thai noodle) is indicative of the overall level of quality here: good, not great. It's just a little too salty, using a noticeably below-average grade of beef; on the other hand, it's only about $7 and is basically a godsend to the cruelly Pad See Ew-less world that was Fort Greene just two short months ago. The curries I've sampled, Panang and Masaman, fare a bit better, though the latter is curiously onion-free.

National also loses points for having a name so generic that it's actually a little confusing, though of course it gains those points right back for being a Thai restaurant but not having words like Lemongrass, Mango, or Thai in its name.

Summing up: Cheap, well-located, and acceptable-quality food that still  leaves a reasonable amount of room for improvement. You've almost definitely had better Thai in your lifetime, but the chances of your having had better Thai in Fort Greene specifically are basically zero.

*Note: "Mango Thai and Mee" sounds like the title of a terrible book, or perhaps a mildly offensive children's cartoon.
review.author: Galvin C.

review.description:
I work around the neighborhood and we frequent here at least 3 times a week out of the 5 day work week!
Its that good! Prices are very fair, and portions are generous.  Waitress are cute & from Thailand!
The Thai Iced Coffee is great along with the Lad Nah noodles w/ beef or chicken.
There are no signs or awnings outside that displays the restaurant's name, but this place is definitely a must go!
review.author: GaMBiT R.

review.description:
Food is AWFUL. Seriously some of the worst Thai food you'll ever experience.

The space is nice though, and thank god someone's finally opened something affordable (that's not hamburgers) in the area, and prices are low. But the food is di-sgusting.
review.author: Janson L.

review.description: A spot recommended by one of the mujeres locas y raunchy. Cash only on Fulton. A group of six accommodated rapidly. The food comes out  impressively piping hot and the broad noodle dish I had was well flavored if not a little one note. My fiance had the spicy noodles which I really enjoyed and our party was generally pleased with the food and the service. I would go back just to try several of the dishes my friends were having and enjoyed.
review.author: Malcolm G.

review.description: I had the worst experience here tonight. I went to dinner with my good friend since I had dined here before during lunch time and enjoyed the good food and great portions. TONIGHT HOWEVER WAS TERRIBLE. Taya, my waitress, was not attentive. She kept walking away from the table as I was trying to place my order, did not give my friend any attention, mixed up my curry entree and tried to convince me it was green when it was actually red and to top it all off gave us the check while we were talking over some drinks. Talk about a buzz kill! The drinks cost more than the food. Why would you kick us out??? I am not pleased with the service at all and will probably not be back. I will no longer recommend this place either. What a waste of a what could be a great place.
review.author: Jen U.
